title: Estimate your Income Tax for the current year

introductory_paragraph.content:
Use this service to estimate how much Income Tax and National Insurance you should pay for the current tax year (6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018). 

This tells you your take-home pay if you don’t have any other deductions, such as pension contributions or student loans.

There are different ways to:

- [check your Income Tax payments for the current year](/check-income-tax-current-year)
- [check how much you paid last year (6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017)](/check-income-tax-last-year)
- [estimate how much you should have paid in a previous year](/check-income-tax)

If you’re self-employed, the [self-employed ready reckoner](/self-assessment-ready-reckoner) tool can help you budget for your tax bill.

You may be able to [claim a refund](/claim-tax-refund) if you’ve paid too much tax.

^If you have more than one job, use the calculator once for each job.^

Use this service to estimate how much Income Tax and National Insurance you should pay for the current tax year (6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018).

This tells you your take-home pay if you don’t have any other deductions, such as pension contributions or student loans.

There are different ways to:

  • check your Income Tax payments for the current year
  • check how much you paid last year (6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017)
  • estimate how much you should have paid in a previous year

If you’re self-employed, the self-employed ready reckoner tool can help you budget for your tax bill.

You may be able to claim a refund if you’ve paid too much tax.

If you have more than one job, use the calculator once for each job.

more_information.content:
You can’t get an estimate online if:

- you're not a pay as you earn (PAYE) taxpayer
- your only income is from self employment or [state benefits](/income-tax/taxfree-and-taxable-state-benefits), such as State Pension
- you contribute to a pension scheme through your employer
- you’re [repaying a student loan](/repaying-your-student-loan)

You can check you’ve paid the right tax by [contacting HMRC](/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs/contact/income-tax-enquiries-for-individuals-pensioners-and-employees) or by getting help from an [accountant](/tax-help).

*[PAYE]: pay as you earn
*[HMRC]: HM Revenue and Customs

You can’t get an estimate online if:

  • you’re not a pay as you earn (PAYE) taxpayer
  • your only income is from self employment or state benefits, such as State Pension
  • you contribute to a pension scheme through your employer
  • you’re repaying a student loan

You can check you’ve paid the right tax by contacting HMRC or by getting help from an accountant.
